text: HI, I'm having issues with the julia workflow I have cloned a repo checked out my own branch, done some changes, committed them, but no matter what I do in the julia repl, update, rm and re add, precompile, restarting julia, activating the branch workspace and trying from there, using dev instead of add. It never seems to pick up my new changes. even when i change the sub version in the toml file, and it picks up the version change, it still doesnt pick up the actual code change. Any advice would be much appreciate :)

elements.text: HI, I'm having issues with the julia workflow I have cloned a repo checked out my own branch, done some changes, committed them, but no matter what I do in the julia repl, update, rm and re add, precompile, restarting julia, activating the branch workspace and trying from there, using dev instead of add. It never seems to pick up my new changes. even when i change the sub version in the toml file, and it picks up the version change, it still doesnt pick up the actual code change. Any advice would be much appreciate :)

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/55148| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!

The usual workflow is to first
`] dev Repo`
This clones the repo for you in `~/.julia/dev` . Modify the repo there will then be picked after restarting julia and `using Repo`. You can also use `Revise.jl` to pick the changes as you modify the files.
